home.title: Characters
home.subtitle: Where fantasy comes alive. Chat with characters — no limits, no filters.
hero.subtitle: Chat with unique characters — no limits, no filters, no judgment. Unlimited creativity.
hero.feature1.title: Unlimited Fantasy
hero.feature1.desc: Any scenario, any character, any story. Your imagination is the only limit.
hero.feature2.title: No Censorship
hero.feature2.desc: SFW, moderate, or NSFW — you choose the content rating. No filters.
hero.feature3.title: 9 AI Providers
hero.feature3.desc: Groq, Cerebras, OpenRouter, Together, DeepSeek, and more. Auto-fallback ensures reliability.
hero.feature4.title: Create Your Own
hero.feature4.desc: Build characters from scratch, generate from text, or import SillyTavern cards.
hero.feature5.title: Group Chats
hero.feature5.desc: Chat with multiple characters at once. They interact with each other and with you.
hero.feature6.title: Lorebooks & Memory
hero.feature6.desc: World info injected by keywords. Chat memory summarizes context across long conversations.

create.nameHint: If not specified, the most interesting character will be chosen
create.extraPlaceholder: E.g.: make the character more sarcastic, add an accent, use informal speech...

lore.title: World Info / Lorebook
lore.hint: Add lore entries with keywords. When a keyword appears in chat, the entry is injected into the AI's context.
lore.empty: No lore entries yet. Add one to enrich the character's world.
lore.contentPlaceholder: Information to inject when keywords are mentioned...
profile.title: Profile
profile.usernameHint: Shown on your character cards as @username
profile.deleteAccountConfirm: This will permanently delete your account, all your characters, and all chat history. This action cannot be undone.
profile.deleteAccountHint: Permanently delete your account and all associated data.
form.name: Character name *
form.slugHint: URL-friendly identifier (a-z, 0-9, hyphens). Used in character URL.
form.personalityPlaceholder: Describe the personality, manner of speech, habits. Write in second person: 'You are...'
form.structuredTagsHint: Affect behavior — add instructions to the prompt
form.appearancePlaceholder: Describe the character's appearance: height, build, facial features, clothing, distinguishing marks...
form.scenarioPlaceholder: Description of the situation, world, and interaction context...
form.greetingPlaceholder: Character's first message when starting a chat. Use *asterisks* for action descriptions.
form.exampleDialoguesPlaceholder:
{{char}}: *adjusts violin* Good day. How may I help you?
{{user}}: Hello!

You can use {{char}} and {{user}} — they'll be replaced with names.
form.instructionsPlaceholder: Additional rules (will be added to system prompt)...
form.maxTokensHelp: Maximum response length. 1 token ≈ 3-4 characters. Default: 2048.
settings.title: Model & Settings
settings.temperatureTooltip:
Controls response randomness.

0.0 — strictly predictable text.
0.3–0.5 — restrained style, few surprises.
0.7 — balance between accuracy and creativity (default).
1.0+ — more creative, unpredictable responses.
2.0 — maximum randomness, text may become incoherent.

Default: 0.7
settings.topPTooltip:
Limits word selection by cumulative probability (nucleus sampling).

The model considers only the most probable words until their cumulative probability reaches this threshold.

0.5 — only top 50% probable words.
0.9 — wider selection, more diverse text.
1.0 — all words available.

Works together with temperature. Usually changing one is enough.

Default: 0.95
settings.topKTooltip:
Limits word selection by count: the model only picks from K most probable options.

0 — disabled, all words available.
10 — only top 10 words, very predictable.
40–50 — good balance.
100 — almost no restrictions.

Default: 0 (disabled)
settings.frequencyPenaltyTooltip:
Reduces probability of repeating the same words within a single response.

0.0 — no penalty, model may repeat.
0.3–0.5 — light penalty, removes obsessive repeats.
1.0 — noticeable penalty, more diverse text.
2.0 — strong penalty (may hurt coherence).

Default: 0.3
settings.presencePenaltyTooltip:
Penalizes words and phrases that already appeared in the dialogue context. Helps avoid repeating the same descriptions from message to message.

0.0 — no penalty.
0.3 — light penalty, fewer cross-message repeats (recommended).
0.6 — noticeable penalty, more diverse responses.
1.0+ — strong penalty, model actively avoids previously mentioned topics.

Default: 0.3
settings.contextLimitTooltip:
How much conversation history the model sees.

4K — ~10-15 messages, fast responses.
8K — ~25-35 messages, good balance.
16K — ~50-70 messages, deep context.
∞ — no limit, all history (may hit model limits).

Older messages beyond the limit are "forgotten" by the model.

Default: ∞ (no limit)
settings.nsfwBlocked: This model doesn't support NSFW content
settings.cerebrasNoPenalty: Cerebras does not support frequency/presence penalty. These settings will be ignored.
settings.maxTokensTooltip:
Maximum response length. 1 token ≈ 3-4 characters.

256 — very short (~750 chars).
1024 — short (~3000 chars).
2048 — medium (~6000 chars).
4096 — long (~12000 chars).

Hard limit: response will be cut off if exceeded.

Default: 2048

tagPage.fantasyDesc: Explore fantasy AI characters — elves, mages, dragons, and mythical worlds. Immersive roleplay without limits.
tagPage.romanceDesc: Chat with romantic AI characters — love stories, dating simulation, and intimate conversations.
tagPage.animeDesc: Anime-inspired AI characters — waifu, shonen heroes, isekai adventures. Your favorite anime worlds come alive.
tagPage.modernDesc: Modern-day AI characters — realistic scenarios, everyday life, contemporary settings and stories.
featured.title: Character of the Day
about.title: About SweetSin
about.p1: SweetSin is a platform for creative roleplay and character-driven conversations. We connect 9 AI providers with richly detailed character profiles to create immersive, literary-quality chat experiences.
about.p2: Choose from dozens of free language models across Groq, Cerebras, OpenRouter, and more — or connect premium models like Claude, GPT-4o, and Gemini. Auto-fallback ensures your conversations never stop.
about.p3: Create characters from scratch, generate them from any text, or import SillyTavern cards. Add lorebooks for world-building, use personas to roleplay as different characters, and chat with multiple characters in group conversations.
about.f.personas.title: User Personas
about.f.personas.desc: Create multiple roleplay personas with names and descriptions. Switch between them across different chats.
about.f.groupChats.title: Group Chats
about.f.groupChats.desc: Add multiple characters to a single conversation. They respond to you and interact with each other.
about.f.lorebooks.title: Lorebooks & World Info
about.f.lorebooks.desc: Attach world-building entries to characters. Info activates automatically when keywords appear in chat.
about.f.memory.title: Chat Memory
about.f.memory.desc: Long conversations are automatically summarized so the AI remembers important details without losing context.
about.f.multiChat.title: Multiple Chats
about.f.multiChat.desc: Start multiple separate conversations with the same character. Each chat has its own context and history.
about.f.models.title: Model Selection
about.f.models.desc: Choose from 9 providers and dozens of models. Adjust temperature, top-p, frequency penalty, and other parameters per chat.
about.f.importExport.title: Import & Export
about.f.importExport.desc: Import characters from SillyTavern card format (v1/v2). Export your characters to share with the community.
about.f.multilingual.title: Multilingual
about.f.multilingual.desc: Full interface and AI responses in English, Russian, and Spanish. Character cards are auto-translated between languages.
about.f.literary.title: Literary Prose
about.f.literary.desc: Third-person narration with dialogue, inner thoughts, and physical descriptions. No asterisk-action patterns.
about.f.privacy.title: Privacy First
about.f.privacy.desc: Your conversations are private. Delete your account and all data at any time from your profile.
about.teamDesc: We believe in the power of creative expression and storytelling. SweetSin provides a space for adults to explore their imagination through character-driven conversations — with the best AI models, rich world-building tools, and complete creative freedom.
terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.intro: By using SweetSin, you agree to the following terms:
terms.section1: You must be at least 18 years old to use this service. By creating an account, you confirm that you meet this requirement.
terms.section2: You are responsible for the characters you create and the content you generate. Do not create content that promotes real-world harm, involves real persons without consent, or violates applicable laws.
terms.section3: You agree not to abuse the platform, attempt to reverse-engineer the service, or use automated tools to scrape content. We reserve the right to suspend accounts that violate these terms.
terms.section4: SweetSin is provided as-is. We do not guarantee uninterrupted service or specific model availability. Generated content may contain inaccuracies.
privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: Your privacy matters to us. Here is how we handle your data:
privacy.section1: We collect your email, username, and chat history to provide the service. We do not sell your data to third parties.
privacy.section2: Your data is used solely to operate the service: account management, chat delivery, and service improvement. Chat content is sent to providers for response generation.
privacy.section3: We use industry-standard encryption and secure hosting. Passwords are hashed and never stored in plain text.
privacy.section4: You can delete your account at any time from your profile page. This permanently removes all your data, characters, and chat history.
faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.a1: Yes! Core features are completely free. We offer dozens of free models via Groq, Cerebras, and OpenRouter. Premium models (Claude, GPT-4o, Gemini) require your own API key.
faq.a2: 9 providers: Groq (Llama 3.3, Kimi K2, Scout, Maverick), Cerebras, OpenRouter (Hermes 405B, Gemma, DeepSeek R1), Together, DeepSeek, Qwen, Anthropic Claude, OpenAI GPT-4o, and Google Gemini. Auto-fallback switches models if one is unavailable.
faq.a3: Yes, for users 18+. You control the content rating per character. Some models (like GPT-OSS) have built-in content restrictions, but most free models support unrestricted content.
faq.q4: How do I create a character?
faq.a4: Click 'Create' in the header. You can build a character manually with personality, appearance, scenario, and example dialogues — or paste any text and let AI generate a character from it. You can also import SillyTavern character cards.
faq.a5: Yes. Your conversations are private and only visible to you. We do not share chat content with anyone.
faq.a6: Yes. Go to Profile and use 'Delete Account' in the Danger Zone section. This permanently removes your account, characters, chats, and all associated data.
faq.a7: Personas let you roleplay as different characters. Create a persona with a name and description in your profile, then select it when starting a new chat. The AI will address you by your persona's name.
faq.a8: Open a chat and add other characters via the group chat panel. Each character responds in turn based on the conversation context. They interact with you and with each other.
faq.a9: Lorebooks are world-building tools. Add entries with keywords — when those keywords appear in chat, the related lore is automatically included in the AI's context. Great for consistent world details.
faq.a10: For long conversations, the AI automatically summarizes earlier messages so it remembers important details even as the context window fills up. You can toggle this per chat in settings.
faq.a11: Yes! Go to Create → Import tab. Upload a SillyTavern character card (JSON, v1 or v2 format) or paste the JSON directly. All fields are mapped automatically.
faq.q12: Can I have multiple chats with the same character?
faq.a12: Yes. Click 'New Chat' on the character page or in the chat header. Each chat has its own independent history, context, and model settings.
